summary: The Torah is the first five books of the Hebrew Bible: Genesis, Exodus, Leviticus, Numbers, and Deuteronomy. It's also called the Pentateuch or Five Books of Moses in Christianity. The Torah can be a scroll or a book (Chumash) with commentaries. It contains written and oral teachings, believed to be given by God to Moses. These teachings were written down and passed down through generations. The Torah is read publicly in synagogues on Mondays and Thursdays, and it's considered sacred by Jews, Samaritans, and Christians, with Muslims also believing it was given by God to the prophets.
title: Torah
